results.title: Hungry Ghosts
results.creator_credit: Zi Zhong Wang, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
During Adelaide’s Chinese cultural week in 1988 a group of puppeteers from Adelaide’s sister city of Penang were invited to present one of their plays in honour of the Festival of Hungry Ghosts which fell at this time. The program shows their ritualistic preparations and some of the other festivities which took place.

results.title: What's mad to you? Part 2. New approaches
results.creator_credit: Barbara A. Chobocky, Margaret Smith and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
A group of psychiatrists and counsellors who offer alternative kinds of psychiatric help talk about their methods. They all stress that the need for change has to come from the patients themselves and that any change is likely to be small and not likely to happen quickly. Some of their patients also talk about their treatment and we are shown brief glimpses of sessions between therapist and patient.

Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.

results.title: Al fresco
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Barbara Mariotti and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
In Adelaide’s Al Fresco Gelataria the young and the single meet friends, watch the passing scene of Rundle St. or strike up new relationships. Part of Adelaide’s thriving cafe society, the patrons of Al Fresco talk about their reasons for coming there, their attitude to peer groups and peer group pressure and how they relate to each other.

results.title: The Story of a thing = La Storia di una cosa
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
A theatrical interpretation by a community theatre group, of the experiences of Italian women migrants, and those of their daughters. Combines stage sequences and interviews to present an appeal to listen, with humour and pathos, from a section of the community which is rarely heard. Italian dialogue, English subtitles.

results.title: Country women
results.creator_credit: Maria Ferro, Kay Donovan and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Newcomers to Australia experience isolation and loneliness, but when a newcomer does not speak English and comes from a non-Anglo culture, this isolation can be even more intense, particularly in rural areas. “Country Women” looks at the work of Sunraysia Multicultural Women’s Association in Mildura and its role as a meeting place for isolated migrant women. Five women share their experiences of adjusting to a new country - German plant breeder, Luise Mock; landscape painter, Petronella Cavallaro; Turkish vineyard owner, Emine Simsek; Hong Kong Chinese student, Teresa Yin Mai Kwok; and South African Indian, Bharti Purchase.

results.title: The Reefkeepers
results.creator_credit: Robert Alcock, Margaret Smith and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Shows the life and work of officers and crew aboard the ship, Cape Moreton, as they maintain shipping beacons and lighthouses in the tropics around Torres Strait. Examines the role of the Australian Lighthouse Service.

results.title: You jump, you fly: a multicultural textile project linking health and art
results.creator_credit: Luigi Acquisto, Australia Council and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
At the Coburg Community Health Centre, Anne Marie Power, textile artist, talks about groups of women that were linked together through a textile project. The common theme revolved around their houses and lives, and the women were able to develop skills which had previously been undervalued. The aim was to increase the self-awareness and self-esteem of the participants thus resulting in better health. The women with well-developed skills taught the others so a sense of group was developed.
